00034 #include <stdio.h>
00035 #include <avr/boot.h>
00036 #include <avr/pgmspace.h>
00037 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00038 #include "dev/rs232.h"
00039 #include "elfloader-arch.h"
00040 #include "lib/mmem.h"
00041 #include <string.h> //memset
00042 
00043 #define R_AVR_NONE             0
00044 #define R_AVR_32               1
00045 #define R_AVR_7_PCREL          2
00046 #define R_AVR_13_PCREL         3
00047 #define R_AVR_16               4
00048 #define R_AVR_16_PM            5
00049 #define R_AVR_LO8_LDI          6
00050 #define R_AVR_HI8_LDI          7
00051 #define R_AVR_HH8_LDI          8
00052 #define R_AVR_LO8_LDI_NEG      9
00053 #define R_AVR_HI8_LDI_NEG     10
00054 #define R_AVR_HH8_LDI_NEG     11
00055 #define R_AVR_LO8_LDI_PM      12
00056 #define R_AVR_HI8_LDI_PM      13
00057 #define R_AVR_HH8_LDI_PM      14
00058 #define R_AVR_LO8_LDI_PM_NEG  15
00059 #define R_AVR_HI8_LDI_PM_NEG  16
00060 #define R_AVR_HH8_LDI_PM_NEG  17
00061 #define R_AVR_CALL            18
00062 
00063 #define ELF32_R_TYPE(info)      ((unsigned char)(info))
00064 
00065 #define DEBUG 0
00066 #if DEBUG
00067 /*#define PRINTF(...) rs232_print_p(RS232_PORT_1, __VA_ARGS__)*/
00068 #define PRINTF(...) printf(__VA_ARGS__)
00069 #else
00070 #define PRINTF(...)
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 static struct mmem module_heap;
00074 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00075 void*
00076 elfloader_arch_allocate_ram(int size)
00077 {
00078   /* Free previously allocated memory */
00079   /* TODO Assumes memory address 0 can't be allocated, use flag instead? */
00080   if (MMEM_PTR(&module_heap) != 0) {
00081     mmem_free(&module_heap);
00082   }
00083   
00084   /* Allocate RAM for module */
00085   if (mmem_alloc (&module_heap, size) ==  0) {
00086     return NULL;
00087   }
00088   
00089   return (char*)MMEM_PTR(&module_heap);
00090 }
00091 
00092 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00093 /* TODO: Currently, modules are written to the fixed address 0x10000. Since
00094  *        flash rom uses word addresses on the AVR, we return 0x8000 here
00095  */
00096 void*
00097 elfloader_arch_allocate_rom(int size)
00098 {
00099   return (void *)0x8000;
00100 }
00101 
00102 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00103 /* Eliminate compiler warnings for (non-functional) code when flash requires 32 bit addresses and pointers are 16 bit */
00104 #define INCLUDE_APPLICATE_SOURCE 1
00105 #ifdef __GNUC__
00106 #if (FLASHEND > USHRT_MAX) && (__SIZEOF_POINTER__ <= 2)
00107 #undef INCLUDE_APPLICATE_SOURCE
00108 #define INCLUDE_APPLICATE_SOURCE 0
00109 #endif
00110 #if (__SIZEOF_POINTER__ > 2)
00111 #define INCLUDE_32BIT_CODE 1
00112 #endif
00113 #endif
00114 #if INCLUDE_APPLICATE_SOURCE
00115 
00116 BOOTLOADER_SECTION void
00117 elfloader_arch_write_rom(int fd, unsigned short textoff, unsigned int size, char *mem)
00118 {
00119     unsigned char   buf[SPM_PAGESIZE];
00120     unsigned short* flashptr = (unsigned short *) mem;
00121 
00122 
00123     // Sanity-check size of loadable module
00124     if (size <= 0)
00125         return;
00126 
00127   
00128     // Seek to patched module and burn it to flash (in chunks of
00129     // size SPM_PAGESIZE, i.e. 256 bytes on the ATmega128)
00130     cfs_seek(fd, textoff, CFS_SEEK_SET);
00131     for (flashptr=(unsigned short *)mem; flashptr < (unsigned short *) mem + size; flashptr += SPM_PAGESIZE) {
00132         memset (buf, 0, SPM_PAGESIZE);
00133         cfs_read(fd, buf, SPM_PAGESIZE);
00134 
00135         // Disable interrupts
00136         uint8_t sreg;
00137         sreg = SREG;
00138         cli ();
00139   
00140         // Erase flash page
00141         boot_page_erase (flashptr);
00142         boot_spm_busy_wait ();
00143         
00144         unsigned short *origptr =  flashptr;
00145 
00146         int i;  
00147         // Store data into page buffer
00148         for(i = 0; i < SPM_PAGESIZE; i+=2) {
00149             boot_page_fill (flashptr, (uint16_t)((buf[i+1] << 8) | buf[i]));
00150             PORTB = 0xff - 7;
00151             ++flashptr;
00152         }
00153         
00154         // Burn page
00155         boot_page_write (origptr);
00156         boot_spm_busy_wait();
00157         
00158         // Reenable RWW sectin
00159         boot_rww_enable ();
00160         boot_spm_busy_wait ();  
00161 
00162         // Restore original interrupt settings
00163         SREG = sreg;
00164     }
00165 }
00166 #endif /* INCLUDE_APPLICATE_SOURCE */
00167 
00168 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00169 static void
00170 write_ldi(int fd, unsigned char *instr, unsigned char byte)
00171 {
00172   instr[0] = (instr[0] & 0xf0) | (byte & 0x0f);
00173   instr[1] = (instr[1] & 0xf0) | (byte >> 4);
00174   cfs_write (fd, instr, 2);
00175 }
00176 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00177 void
00178 elfloader_arch_relocate(int fd, unsigned int sectionoffset,
00179         //                      struct elf32_rela *rela, elf32_addr addr)
00180                         char *sectionaddr,
00181                         struct elf32_rela *rela, char *addr)
00182 {
00183   unsigned int type;
00184   unsigned char instr[4];
00185 
00186   cfs_seek(fd, sectionoffset + rela->r_offset, CFS_SEEK_SET);
00187   cfs_read(fd, instr, 4);
00188   cfs_seek(fd, sectionoffset + rela->r_offset, CFS_SEEK_SET);
00189   
00190   type = ELF32_R_TYPE(rela->r_info);
00191 
00192   addr += rela->r_addend;
00193 
00194   switch(type) {
00195   case R_AVR_NONE:
00196   case R_AVR_32:
00197     PRINTF(PSTR ("elfloader-avr.c: unsupported relocation type: "));
00198     PRINTF("%d\n", type);
00199     break;
00200 
00201   case R_AVR_7_PCREL: { /* 4 */
00202     /*
00203      * Relocation is relative to PC. -2: branch instructions add 2 to PC.
00204      * Do not use >> 1 for division because branch instructions use
00205      * signed offsets.
00206      */
00207     int16_t a = (((int)addr - rela->r_offset -2) / 2);
00208     instr[0] |= (a << 3) & 0xf8;
00209     instr[1] |= (a >> 5) & 0x03;
00210     cfs_write(fd, instr, 2);
00211   }
00212     break;
00213   case R_AVR_13_PCREL: { /* 3 */
00214     /*
00215      * Relocation is relative to PC. -2: RJMP adds 2 to PC.
00216      * Do not use >> 1 for division because RJMP uses signed offsets.
00217      */
00218     int16_t a = (int)addr / 2;
00219     a -= rela->r_offset / 2;
00220     a--;
00221     instr[0] |= a & 0xff;
00222     instr[1] |= (a >> 8) & 0x0f;
00223     cfs_write(fd, instr, 2);
00224   }
00225     break;
00226 
00227   case R_AVR_16:    /* 4 */
00228     instr[0] = (int)addr  & 0xff;
00229     instr[1] = ((int)addr >> 8) & 0xff;
00230 
00231     cfs_write(fd, instr, 2);
00232     break;
00233 
00234   case R_AVR_16_PM: /* 5 */
00235     addr = (char *)((int)addr >> 1);
00236     instr[0] = (int)addr  & 0xff;
00237     instr[1] = ((int)addr >> 8) & 0xff;
00238 
00239     cfs_write(fd, instr, 2);
00240     break;
00241 
00242   case R_AVR_LO8_LDI: /* 6 */
00243     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr);
00244     break;
00245   case R_AVR_HI8_LDI: /* 7 */
00246     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 8);
00247     break;
00248 
00249 #if INCLUDE_32BIT_CODE       /* 32 bit AVRs */
00250   case R_AVR_HH8_LDI: /* 8 */
00251     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 16);
00252     break;
00253 #endif
00254 
00255   case R_AVR_LO8_LDI_NEG: /* 9 */
00256     addr = (char *) (0 - (int)addr);
00257     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr);
00258     break;
00259   case R_AVR_HI8_LDI_NEG: /* 10 */
00260     addr = (char *) (0 - (int)addr);
00261     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 8);
00262     break;
00263     
00264 #if INCLUDE_32BIT_CODE         /* 32 bit AVRs */
00265   case R_AVR_HH8_LDI_NEG: /* 11 */
00266     addr = (char *)(0 - (int)addr);
00267     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 16);
00268     break;
00269 #endif
00270 
00271   case R_AVR_LO8_LDI_PM: /* 12 */
00272     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 1);
00273     break;
00274   case R_AVR_HI8_LDI_PM: /* 13 */
00275     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 9);
00276     break;
00277 
00278 #if INCLUDE_32BIT_CODE         /* 32 bit AVRs */
00279   case R_AVR_HH8_LDI_PM: /* 14 */
00280     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 17);
00281     break;
00282 #endif
00283 
00284   case R_AVR_LO8_LDI_PM_NEG: /* 15 */
00285     addr = (char *) (0 - (int)addr);
00286     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 1);
00287     break;
00288   case R_AVR_HI8_LDI_PM_NEG: /* 16 */
00289     addr = (char *) (0 - (int)addr);
00290     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 9);
00291     break;
00292     
00293 #if INCLUDE_32BIT_CODE         /* 32 bit AVRs */
00294   case R_AVR_HH8_LDI_PM_NEG: /* 17 */
00295     addr = (char *) (0 - (int)addr);
00296     write_ldi(fd, instr, (int)addr >> 17);
00297     break;
00298 #endif
00299 
00300   case R_AVR_CALL: /* 18 */
00301         /* old solution: 
00302      addr = ((int16_t)addr >> 1);
00303      instr[2] = (int16_t)addr & 0xff;
00304      instr[3] = (int16_t)addr >> 8;
00305         */
00306 
00307         /* new solution */
00308     instr[2] = (u8_t) ((int)addr) & 0xff;
00309     instr[3] = ((int)addr) >> 8;
00310     cfs_write(fd, instr, 4);
00311     break;
00312 
00313   default:
00314     PRINTF(PSTR ("Unknown relocation type!\n"));
00315     break;
00316   }
00317 }
00318 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00319 void
00320 elfloader_unload(void) {
00321 }
